i was really pumped up seeing the first few scenes but then i had to leave and upon coming back i just couldnt force myself to watch it very boring and generic esp the gun fight scenes in club i knew it will expire after 48 hours in youtube but just couldnt make myself watch it it became extremely dull and boring and nothing captivated my attention after the club fight scenei gave it 3 stars because the introduction of baba yaga was amazing as well as dropping the russian language bomb in gas stationcool concept but badly executed also the fight scenes are not machine like and precise and clean like bourne or equilibriummeh film

i have seen twice once before watching oldboy and once afteron my first viewing i loved the film the scenes at the start which kickstart the plot were so unexpected and shocking that i immediately wanted to go out and kill many many peoplethe film was not plot heavy but it wasnt really about the plot it was about the action scenes and the action scenes were beautiful the styling of the action scenes were it pulls away and creates a dynamic movement thats elegant and precise and isnt cut to shit so you can actually see whats going on was amazing to me at the time the nightclub scene alone is one of the most incredible pieces of action cinema that i had scene the action styling was perfect it didnt reduce impact and cut away for a pg13 rating and the way in which it dimmed the sounds of the violence and turned up the music made it seem almost like a dance and the world building i was fascinated by this world the golden coins and the hotel and all of the little intricacies laced into the movies were incredible in short i loved this film first time aroundthen i watched park chan wooks oldboyoldboy is a masterpiecewatch iton my second viewing of i was viciously let down after the first fifteen minutes in which the events that kickstart the plot take place the plot ends thats it after that kills people for an hour and a half even the world building that enchanted me so much the first time around fell flat on a second viewing it just seemed rushed and only existed so that john could kill somebody else it was a means to an end and that showed people could argue isnt about the plot its about creating a clean stylish action flick with stylized yet unflinching and realistic violence but to those people i say have you watched oldboy everything that makes the violence in so good came from oldboy the dulling of the impact not clear and precise but thick and realistic comes from oldboy the long action takes the gorgeous action choreography all from oldboy the other thing that oldboy has that doesnt is plot now the clean stylish action flick is fine by me but if its as unoriginal as and everything in it has been done many times better in a movie that didnt sacrifice plot for violence and delivered masterfully on both just dont bother watch oldboy it has a plot and fight scenes cooler than the ones in where enemies dont feel the need to come one at a time so john can pick them off

i considered turning this film off early on but did not because i was hoping that something would take place to redeem it not to mention that in general i tend to watch films to the end whatever style was attempted for this film failed miserably the hotel could have taken out the murderer of his and thief of his car very early in the film when he eyed him in the bath he shoots everyone in sight except his target i find that kind of scene a mechanism to keep the story going to be weak thumbs down i dont know what i was thinking ordering this movie i generally do not care for keanu reeves acting

i love an action movie but in amongst all the stunts car chases and fight scenes i do expect a little bit of suspense intrigue and good script this film has none of the latter this might sound very snobbish but youd have to be of a certain age andor intelligence to rate this movie highlyyes its fun and mindless entertainment but nothing mre than that ive never seen so many people killed in one movie and that includes war films and all killed by one man john there was easily about 100 different gun shots to the head and face in this movie the first few are kind of entertaining and then it gets ridiculousi cant recommend this movie to anyoneperiod

keanu reeves does not act in this movie this is simply another violent copy of so many other movies i cant think of anything positive to say about this movie i am half way through 2 and cant watch anymore with so many people raving about these movies i am sure a third one is already in production too bad

i just saw this movie today roughly three years after release and cant believe that it took me so long to watch this the reviews dont do it justice and as others have said on paper the premise doesnt look that interesting which might also be why i overlooked this this is a revenge action flick and the only thing i can think of to explain the lower reviews is that some people just dont like revenge action movies in generalthe story isnt very complex which is typical of revenge action typically i prefer a little complexity pure action like transformers and max max road fury usually isnt my thing however while the story is simple there is just enough of a story to separate this movie from the two i just mentioned some people say the action in this movie is non stop but i disagree there are small breaks just when you need them to explain the films universe and its characters another thing that separates this movie from pure action films like mad max road fury is that there is an actual clearly established goal and you are given a very strong reason to actually care about the protagonist and his desire to accomplish it not to mention an unusually strong reason to really really hate its antagonistsas for the acting i was very impressed by its lead hero played by keanu reeves hes stepped up his game from previous films he can really sell the emotion of sadness this time which was critical in this movie if he acted the way he did in the matrix this whole movie would not have worked for me

i think the director started from the correct observation that too many revenge movies have very similar premises the protagonist is revenging his family the wife and daughter in death wish the unborn baby and a four year coma in kill bill the wife in memento the family in gladiator etc so instead of thinking that there might be a good reason for this family premise thing our storyteller decides to break the mold and have the protagonist revenge his puppy a totally excessive and brutal retaliation in which dozens die together with the perpetrator and his father but then again on a second thought maybe its not good to break completely free of this family premise after all so lets make the puppy be a present from the recently deceased wife oh but maybe the puppy is not enough lets have the expensive sports car of the protagonist be also stolenthere there now were creative novel traditional and have insured that a large audience can clearly empathize with our keanu protagonist and cheer at the death of the bad people who did all these horrible thingsbesides this lack of a reason for its existence the revenge is well executed thus 6 stars

is one of my alltime favourite movies full of highly stylized action frequent droll wit and a relentless pace its loaded with action and violence but unlike a lot of action movies action sequences dont stop to dwell in gore  they just keep blazing along suits me perfectlyi cant imagine better casting the many supporting players are superb and reeves is outstanding he does so much with extremely subtle movements and expressions  along of course with all the martial arts gymnasticsi wish this could be rerun in theatres

leaves you breathless from the amount of action and killing if you enjoy simple stories with a lot of guns killings and simple dialog this movie is for youthese stupid spoiled rich russian kids unknowingly attack and start the fuse that leads to massive unbridled mayhem in the city is an assassin who cannot be defeated apparently since theyve made a 2 but its not for wont of trying because boy do the bad guys through everything at him including the kitchen sinkkeanu reeves does a good job of being stoic every so often throwing out clich lines as hes killing people non stop i loved his interaction with his associate wilem defoe which was a highlight of the movie the story is simple the plot is not complicated the action is heart stopping if you like these kinds of movies you wont be disappointed good luck  be prepared for the ride

as chapter 2 is on screens and gets unexpected good reviews and not only from fans i thought that its a good opportunity to see the first and original which also received some positive echos much above what is typically delivered for a film in its genre its certainly a matter of setting expectations but i personally was not disappointed if violent action movies are one of the genres that entertain you good chances that you will not be disappointed eitherrule 1 to enjoy such a film is to accept the conventions of the genre the story takes place in the parallel universe of the crime underworld although bodies start to accumulate in piles pretty soon there is no policeman in view with the exception of one cop showing up at one point looking at the scene of the carnage and wishing good evening to the hero who happens to be a professional killer this parallel universe is not lawless its just that the laws or better said the rules are different there is a code of honor there are territories of neutrality and there is only one punishment  death  for breaking rules or trespassing borders at the roots of the story stands a failed tentative by the main hero to break the cycle of violence of his profession and jump in the universe of normal people all this is just memories when the action starts this film is for keanu reeves what jack reacher is for tom cruise and i suspect that at some point even taking the name of the hero as a title is not a coincidence its the start of a series and the second installment was not too late to comeassuming you bought into the story and the convention there is some good stuff to enjoy stuntman chad stahelski is sitting for the first time on the film director chair and he delivers exactly what is expected  a coherent story telling and perfect choreography of the many action scenes that occupy more than half of the duration of the movie keanu reeves delivers what is expected and a few other fine actors show up in small and even smaller supporting roles cinematography is just beautiful with combinations of dark colors that fit well the violent dark universe that they populate if you can just forget how sketchy the whole story or pretext of the film is you have good reasons to enjoy it

you must let the suspension of disbelief prevail when you watch youll enjoy it more by not going in with expectations of realism its nearly a super antihero moviei have two complaints the spark that ignites on his killing rampage could have been better the interconnections of the mafia thugs accidentally meeting him at the gas station was just too coincidental and random to work well also i wasnt sure what all the burnouts in the mustang was about maybe it was filmed for a sequence that was never completed maybe the director needed some filler maybe keanu just wanted to spin the tyres of an awesome muscle carbesides those niggles i loved the stylized violence very tight direction and the sheer number of deaths packed tightly in a fast moving easy to follow plot a perfect movie to watch when downing several beersthis film is the very definition of a violent action movie a bit like those i remember from my youth we knew what we were getting if we rented anything with van damme schwarzenegger jackie chan or stallone in it now we have one by reeves

now ive seen mr also doing something human like sleeping in a bed sharing some breakfast with a lovely little dogimpressive scene discovering the puppy and reading his dead wifes letter as the first film of a manchad stahelski the director who has previously been a stuntman and a martial artist its a great achievement accumulating considerable experience as a stuntman in films as point break 1991 the matrix 1999 the matrix reloaded 2003 the matrix revolutions 2003 constantine 2005  man of tai chi 2013 all with keanu reeves it was natural that stahelski and reeves will work together again achieving something even more spectacular good action and great music

i liked it it doesnt deserve 10 stars but was a good movie a combination between james bond with daniel craig and jason stathams movies i havent watched many movies with keanu reeves lately and im glad i saw this now ill watch the chapter 2 to see how is it i hope ill like it

watched with kenau reeves47 roninas michael nyqvistmission impossible ghost protocol as viggo tarasov alfie allengame of thrones as iosef tarasovadrianne palickigi joe retaliation as msperkins bridget moynahanbattle los angeles as helen dean winters30 rock as avi ian mcshanehercules as winston john leguizamoride along as aurelio willem dafoeout of the furnace as marcusi really enjoyed its semi original and film anaylst robert meyer burnett pointed out it was very comic book like i though kenau reeves this has to be one of his best roles since the matrix amazing music by tyler batesguardians of the galaxycinematography by jonathan selalaw abiding citizen costume design by luca moscaparanoia and direction by chad stahelskipoint break a comicbooklike movie not based on any comicbook 810

john simplicity is what brings this movie from a minor league to a major league in its glory gives us as viewers eye candy to watch over and over im rating this action film high because this is one of the very few action movies i can watch over and over it does have its shortcomings however fails to deliver new action thrills and sticks with the same old movie tropes that we have become accustomed to just as the matrix set a tone for this almost masterpiece it suffers from ive seen that before oh but thats a great scene i recommend for people who like action and a simple plot thank you for reading

another typical adrenalinefuelled revenge flick lowlife angers unstoppable killing machine carnage follows secondary subplot develops further carnage lowlife dies secondary subplots resolved by additional carnage semiredemptive ending with unstated promise of a sequel  need i say more the movie would have benefited from little more focus on the underworld motif and a few less exploding suvs and generic russianmafia corpsesinwaiting if you like this kind of thing in general youll really like the movie hence the relatively high imdb score if you dont you likely wont make it past the first death i fall somewhere in between i like these kind of movies when there is some substance underlying the style unfortunately there is nothing to beyond endless photogenic but interchangeable fight scenes

this is a great action movie the premise is as simple as it is effective loses everything and goes on a revenge spree the reason why it works so well is that the characters and the setting are both very interesting and the action scenes are very goodthe movie is set in an almost comic book like world where theres a community of hit men and people in the underworld with their own set of morals and code they all use certain businesses or services which ties them all together its this universe that makes me curious for sequels to the characters in this universe are mostly quite fun and a lot of that owes to great casting the way they gradually reveal john past is interesting and it leaves you wanting to know more about who he once wasbut despite all the good things about the movie it never elevates above its genre

without being able to claim to be a particular fan of keanu reeves then i had very little expectations to prior to sitting down and watching it i knew it was in the action thriller genre and that was about itand now that i have seen it i must honestly admit that i was more than pleasantly surprised with the outcome of this movie i was more than entertained by the storyline and the sheer volume of action sequences in the movie is more than sufficient to keep any action fan more than happy i will actually go as far as to saying that this is actually among the more enjoyable and entertaining of movies that i have seen starring keanu reevesthe storyline in all its simplicity is about a retired gunforhire played by keanu reeves who just lost his beloved wife and as a small puppy shows up at this doorstep as a last gift from his departed wife john finds some reason to continue on in his grief and his downtrodden world however when a group of russian thugs steal his car and kills his puppy they have no idea who they are messing with nor the magnitude of his skills and capabilitieswhile the story is fairly simple it is tremendously entertaining and the added spice of all the action sequences really help lift up the movie to a very enjoyable level the action sequences are really well executed and equally well filmedis not a movie that requires any thinking from the audience so you just simply sit back and enjoy the actioni am rating a solid seven out of ten stars and it was good to see a movie of this scale from keanu reeves if you enjoy action movies then is highly recommendable

is the kind of action movies which will remind the action films fans of the movies in late 80s and early 90s the action scenes were paced well and entertaining also this movie must have definitely given relief to keanu reeves as he delivered a hit after long time especially after the disastrous 47 ronin i felt that michael nyqvist as the main antagonist was cool and at the same time menacing along with other secondary villains another best part of the movie was that this film was not dragged like other action films in recent times i am definitely waiting for the sequel which is releasing in 2017 and would hope it would develop into a better franchise is one such movie that should be seen without any logic and would prove to be entertaining on any weekend

keanu reeves is the of the title a grieving one man army who gets tipped over the edge when gangsters kill his carnage ensuesthe paying public do like a good revenge flick there have been plenty this last couple of decades and they do go down well once the setup has been staged  grieves at the loss of his loved one  gets some small joy via a pet  only to have that snatched away from him then the film becomes a joyously unstoppable actionerin good hands with a moody and beefy reeves face fuzz strange though strong in presence cuts a swathe through the gangland eastern blockers and thats pretty much it characterisations are thin on the ground its a bit nutty and of course preposterous but boy is it fun there you go a box office winning actioner without pretensions enjoy 710

did a great job of bringing back a proper action packed movie dont be fooled there is no storyline at all there is just keanu being awesome i was entertained through the entire moviethis is the best keanu movie since the matrix he goes back to his classic cool demeanor and is extremely entertaining delivering his cheesy lines he just kicks everyones backside the entire time and does it with ease he basically takes on an entire army the stunts and effects crew deserves a lot of respect for this its a great action flick and that cant be done without a great crew there were long fantastically choreographed fight sequences it is all fast moving and extremely entertaining non stop action this is exactly what you want in an action movie like thiswas pure entertainment keanu was back to being keanu and the fight sequences were awesome watch if you are an action lover 710

this is a film that you just sit back with a bowl of popcorn and devour it has a simple plot that moves quickly to set up the action scenes the writing is well done and allows the viewer to follow the story while being invested in the characters it could have been just another mindless action flick but the actors and the dialogue give it some depth to make it a film worth watching more than once keanu reeves a retired legend in the assassin world mourns for his dead wife her last gift to him is a puppy and a note telling him to love and find peace it doesnt take long for iosef tarasov alfie allen to mess up johns path to these things in response delves back into the criminal world he left behind to seek retribution for iosefs actions the story weaves past life into his present life and reconnects him with old faces including the female assassin ms perkins adrianne palicki friend willem dafoe and former employer viggo tarasov michael nyqvist he faces the difficult task of breaking viggos organization to get to the man who took his mourning period away from him viggos sonput this on sit back and expect a film that delivers for the expectations of action a simple but tight story and an enjoyable time

keanu reeves plays the liam neeson role in this slick sharp vicious little bout of revenge fantasy with support work from a whole mess of i know that guys and a blowaway effects budget its a real riot to watch not to mention one hell of a tech demo for the masterminds behind the fight scenes like those neeson killemalls though its as straight as an arrow and shallower than the kiddie pool in some ways its refreshing to just dispense with all the stereotypical origin trappings and get right into the firefights but at the end of the show it just feels like one long easy excuse to watch a whole mess of cool stuff without any extra justification lustworthy cars ferocious weaponry powerful westernstyled physicality stereothumping tunes magnificent cityscapes the list just goes on and on escapists delight for has come to deliver a dream cinephiles well just sit back and try to let the sheer celebratory brutality beat your conscience into submission it wont be too difficult

it feels like a very long time that keanu reeves has been out of the game for the last film of his i believe i saw before was the matrix revolutions way back in 2003 hes had films in between now and then of course but i suppose none of them have really caught my fancy or been highly praised enough to warrant a view then out of nowhere along comes that everyone is raving about and saying reeves is back i was delighted in fact im disappointed with myself that ive taken this long to see it nevertheless it was worth the waitthe film isnt really what i expected first of all the kill count was astronomically higher than i ever would have expected secondly the style caught me quite off guard hitman characters are always cool theres no way around that but was another level on from that the scene with the policeman showing up at the door and being entirely comfortable with the fact that there was a dead body lying on the floor over shoulder was absolutely perfect and set the tone for the rest of the film brilliantly this was no ordinary assassin if there is such a thing reeves performance was good the role was suited to him in the sense that he didnt have a tremendous amount of dialogue and he could get by with the odd oneliner here and there to carry things through say what you want about the mans acting abilities but he portrays cool like few others can i read that this is intended to carry on into a trilogy so it will be interesting to see where they go from here i think a lot of what made this so enjoyable for so many people was probably the same feeling i got of witnessing something you hadnt expected obviously that effect will not be available to them in the sequels and i feel like they will struggle to up the body count so what exactly it is theyll do to keep it fresh im not sure however they choose to go about it though ill be happy to see another outing from

aahhh it took me a while to watch this movie because it looks like just another bad action flick the poster is not helping either i love films from foreign docsfestival to the hollywood blockbusters of all genres i hunt for certain directors and i do love intellectual films or some might call them art flicks but the genre that i do miss is the action trash  grind house films  in the glory days of vhs many films were released only for the vhs market many of those are the simple dirty action films some are bad and some are so bad its great wellreminds me of that no bs revenge filmsif you are aware of the charles bronsons death wish has a similar idea recently i am very happy with what liam neeson does  taken 12 and a walk among tombstone has similar feel  dont expect cannes films or look for holes this is like i said a b movie on a mainstream market great ride shootem up midnight snack  only if those seedy cinemas still around

directed by chad stahelski stars keanu reeves as a retired hitman when his wife dies and his cute puppy is killed embarks upon a quest for revenge standing in his way is viggo tarasov michael nyqvist a local gangster with hundreds of men at his disposaljohn a loveletter to over 70 years of action movies its oldest ancestor is fritz langs the big heat a 1953 film in which a vengeful cop takes down the mob bosses responsible for carbombing his wife other blatant influences include john boormans point blank sergio leones spaghetti westerns john woos hong kong action flicks the crime dramas of jeanpierre melville yojimbo payback 1999 and the toughguy films of charles bronson mr majestyk in particular where differs from these films is in its slick action sequences this is unsurprising stahelski has long been a stunt coordinatorhas been compared to gareth evans raid movies but unlike evans work has a sense of humour it knows its ridiculous and its wellhoned comicbook dialogue manages to be simultaneously funny and portentous indeed the film spends 30 minutes hyping up the superhuman dangers of who subsequently unleashes himself upon every mobster in the film like a lavaspewing mount vesuvius more interesting though is the world stahelski has created like alice in wonderland with machine guns this is a dream world which seems to exist 2 inches below contemporary reality willem dafoe costars7910  worth one viewing

much has been said of late about the rather sorry state of the modern action film and apparently the makers of were paying close attentioneschewing elaborate car chases shakycam action sequences and cuisinart editing in favor kinetic but not overly elaborate fight scenes is the blueprint for how to deliver white knuckle thrills without all the phony bolognaalso working in its favor is a simple straightforward plot thats supplemented with some really nice world building the cast lead by the ever underrated keanu reeves is exceptional and really help to lift the material to another levelmay not be art but it doesnt aspire to be like its title character its aim is true if youre in the mood for action hes the man for the job

well this isnt reeves worst film its probably somewhere in the middle it reminds me a lot of those mindless 80s action films that were led by silvester stallone arnold schwarzenegger and chuck norristhe plot is simple no problem this is an action film and theres plenty of it think 80s action films but with more gore and intensity it all looks pretty too this is supposed to be a fun movie i get it but it wouldve been nice to see more realistic gun fights that showed john using his entire repertoire of skills to take out dozens of armed gunmen instead of just showing his incredible quickness and ridiculous gun shooting accuracy im not sure how this film got rated above a 7 the film looks pretty but the script is awful and the characters are uninteresting if you want to watch an action film thats been recently released and are similar to this i suggest watching either shooter or olympus has fallen these films are just as violent but are more interesting to watch

dont get me wrong i didnt dislike this i just thought it lacked substance mr reeves fits the role well hes the sad loner type with hidden depths who is seething beneath that unreadable exterior what i found hard to swallow was the seemingly vast assortment of similar characters and the almost comedic stereotyped mobsters who are so incompetent there are ways to make this type of action realistic and more believable jason bourne trilogy but this film just relies on clichs to carry it along its one man against an incompetent mob and from the minute you see it start to get going you know the outcome all very predictable for most people which left me feeling a little bored cinematography is good its stylish in a simple sort of way but what little dialogue there is could easily have been omitted and you would have no problem following the simple plot i suspect this has either been taken from the plot of a video game or will be made into one for those people who like mindless killing sprees and first person shooters

i saw this movie cant say i loved it or hated it it was passable what baffles me is how many people seem to love this film there are much better films out there that do the same storywhy latch on to this one keanu is used wisely meaning he doesnt say much the supporting actors are all great but theyre not given much to dothe choreography is passable it seemed to be that this was the only reason the movie exists and in that case id say its a bit of letdown it starts off great but it doesnt really go anywhereplateaus earlythe cinematography is very good and the music is appropriatelike i said a passable film but i couldnt find anything that stands out here payback taken and borne identity all do it better

i am a big keanu reeves fan i was looking forward to this movie and for the most part i was watching it with a huge smile on my facethe action is brilliant reeves does some original stuff in his fight sequences and makes them look believablebut there were several scenes which took the movie down a few pegs in my opinion keanus super tough character struggling to take down a girl who looks more like she should be selling perfume than she would be capable of fighting and killing sorry this is not remotely believablegetting caught and needing to be saved time and again throughout the film how amateurish watch the bourne trilogy instead bourne never made the mistake of letting anyone know where he was which is why he was always a step ahead of his pursuers if he ever got picked up hed planned it in advance so as to attain information by contrast continually blundered into situations that would have seen his end in an even half way real worldbut the fight scenes were original and awesome oh yeah and regarding keanus acting being terrible which is what ive read from others here on the discussion board and in reviews he cries when he reads his wifes letter and he makes it look more believable than most actors ive seen dealing with similar emotional scenes his acting was greatso will you walk away from this film considering it a masterpiece not if you like a decent amount of believability and logic in your story linesbut is worth watching yes if only for the fight scenesi may even buy it on blu ray just for those moments

most people have touched on the plot and such so im not going to run on that same thingone of my biggest issues other than the overly spoken about plot by others is the crappy action is suppose to be this bad a which he was pretty bad a with a gun but hand to hand combat he stunk i mean he was so very bad every time he had no gun and went hand to hand fighting im sorry but since the plot stunk and you portray as a bad a why did you write him as such a stink when it comes to the hand to hand combatif you like a movie with a plot dont even try this movie if you like a movie with a bad a again this movie isnt for you you want a bad a guy in a movie watch the equalizer that plot is far superior to this movie and denzel is actual a bad a except very end scenes they sorta got off track

after years i watched the movie as the result of my friends insistance on the claim that it is a unique film and different from all the other works in the genreunfortunately this is one of the worst action movie among the ones ive seenordinary full of cliche lack of aesthetic and far from a solid storydo we have to suppose that being heartbroken and agonised film tells sources of these emotional accumulation in 23 minutes is an enough motivation to kill numbers of men does this motivation provide any profoundness to the movie is the director aware of the wizards like tarantino besson scott etc

those clich about russian is bad guy and american a good one is such a boring there is no story only killing and russian bad guy yes it is action movie but really you still whant new ivan drago from rocky

while this movie is definitely light on story and characters theres no way youd be watching this movie if thats what you were looking for this is a fantastic action movie filled with perfectly choreographed violence and an epic soundtrack the cinematography and color palette are what really kept me watching all the way through this movie is a feast for the eyes of anyone who appreciates great filmmaking i would highly recommend this movie to fans of amazing shot composition and action if youre not too into violence i would at least urge you to check out the soundtrack as its great
i like this movie he has a lot of action this the best movie in my entire life i recommend people to watch this

is a breath of fresh air for those tired of the jump cut style action moves of the 2000s keanu reeves trained extensively for this film and it really shows no more infinite magazines and confusing jump cuts

theres a reason why works big time as an atypical action filmthe film is dark brutal and everything an extremely serious action film should bethe first 30 minutes are enough to prove thisthen we have some really unconventional action sequences that are both real and stylized at the same time keanu reeves is really one of the greatest action stars and this role is pretty much tailormade for himwhile the film might feel slow in the beginning you can realize it later on that like any other intelligent action movie it needed a proper setup to get us invested emotionally in the characters and action sequences that followturns out to be different from other killingmachine actioners in terms of its action and the universe its set in every character has something to offer to the story and the action sequences are filmed in a natural and realistic style honestly i was expecting another quickcutting action choreography like in most modern action movies dont get me wrong i am a huge fan of the quick cutting technique but the longtake action choreography involving mostly guns won me over this is hollywood action cinema at its best

this is enjoyable enough  just a couple of things though  it doesnt really have a story and hardly a plot  it also has the faintest subtitles all across the screen which you can hardly see  otherwise if you enjoy seeing mass slaughter on a grand scale set to music then this is just for you  not good for animal lovers

it was a good action film and i did really enjoy it but where the action and the background music were loud the actors spoke too quietly it was very confusing as i sometimes had to rewind scenes to hear what was going on

contains mild spoilersim confused why this film has such a high average rating the plot of the entire film revolves around being some kind of super assassin the best of the bestduring the film we see him kill people with guns knives other random objects and his bare hands it seems everyone in the criminal world knows him everywhere he goes people know who he is even door men at clubs they all seem to know that nobody messes with john yet at the beginning of the film he is beaten up by some criminals that broke in to his home these criminals come from a gang which he worked with 4 years previous everyone in this gang appears to know who he is except for the 4 guys that raided his home  how convenientthe problems with the plot are as followssuper assassin has no home securitysuper assassin goes down stairs in the middle of the night following his that woke him up and does not consider the may have heard somethingsuper assassin can shoot people through walls without having to see where they are happens later in the film but cant tell there are 4 guys in his own housesuper assassin does not even attempt to block blows from guys in his house beating him up but exhibits super martial arts skills later in the filmim not done yetsuper assassin can do head shot after head shot for minutes on end then misses multiple times when aiming at key characters whose death would have ended the film prematurely this happens twice once when the son in running from the pool and again when the father is in the carthe way the director plays with john abilities now he is god now he is mortal now god again depending on which fits his forced plot ruined the film for me

not being a fan of action movies i watched this on tv out of a mild liking for keanu reeves i know he has a reputation as a bad actor but at least he never tries anything he cannot handlereeves is a superassassin living in what i gather or hope is a parallel world retired to live with his wife but she died and left him a puppy as a goodbye giftthe premise of the retired professional is one of the stalest in the movie world such as the killer with a heart and we get both in this movie gets out of retirement to avenge the killing of his and the theft of his car obviously it is no regular villain who angered him but the reckless son of a russian megamobstermoving from his designer villa to the city of new york gets to stay in a luxury hotel called the continental where criminals must refrain from conducting business or else being excommunicated from the great criminal brotherhoodcriminal pals are sympathetic about loss and also scared of him because of his fierce reputation knowing that honor among thieves and criminal luxury world are bullst helps rooting for revenge it also helps that the villains are russian mobsters and everybody knows the world can do without themas in every action movie one also knows that the hero is next to indestructible and that some preposterous fighting scenes will pave the way to a car chase sequence or viceversa as long as you keep your expectations low will deliver reeves is predictably laconic and the world his character inhabits is suitably menacing and dark a sort of lawless gotham cityps i did not see this threadbare plot as an opening for sequels there being very little original material to carve out more stories but unfortunately it happened and it just went downhill

in this 100 minute long action sequence the action is relentless theres action action some more action and then just for good measure an added dose of action fans of the action genre will love it especially since they dont have to concern themselves with any sort of plotseriously though is so blatantly actionoriented that any intentions of coming up with a plot and sticking to it go completely out of the window within the first 20 minutes or so the film gets so carried away with itself that any story that it was supposed to be telling is soon forgotten aboutif this is what the action genre has been reduced to then why not just make a generic special effect show reel instead of pretending that theres some sort of interesting plot behind whats happening on screen when there blatantly isnt

what can i say about a movie i had to turn off at the halfway mark the main character is a gary stu male version of mary sue his character is so unrealistic and blown out of proportion that i couldnt handle it anymore if youre over 21 and you like this film i feel bad for youthe russian villain omg so clich this guy is a pure gingerbread man everything from his cool and collected toneofvoice his accent to the fact that he is an avid drinker make him completely uninteresting

if you like action maybe you can bare this for the full duration of the filmi have personal preferences for keanu reevess acting he is quite talented actor and i believe he did some really good titles the problem he has in this film is the scenario i guess there is not much part from go kill some poor fellows he all of sudden obviously there was a trigger for this he went from a pensioner to killing spray machine similar to the matrixobviously he sometimes got wounds otherwise it would have been a lower rate from me no matter how fond i am to him since the time he played neo the chosen one in the matrixin a sum  my rating is a bit higher than it should if you like action shooting and blood  you may like it there is a story but it is not yet developed  hope they would be better in chapter two this film has no specific cinematographic qualities and wont be something to remember in a month after you see it for a first time

keanu reeves is a highly regarded hit man for the russian mob who has gotten married and retired sadly five years later his wife dies and he is overcome with grief anticipating the impact her death will have upon him his wife makes one last secret arraignment and has a little puppy sent to him a few days after her funeral as a parting gift realizing the love behind the gift he immediately becomes attached it however one morning while walking down the stairs of his home he is hit on the head by a thug named iosef tarasov alfie allen and before losing consciousness watches as it is killed in front of him afterward iosef and two other hoodlums then steal his mint 69 mustang and leave that afternoon these same thugs take it to a body shop to sell but the owner recognizes who it belongs to and refuses to have anything to do with them as it turns out iosef is the son of a russian mob boss by the name of viggo tarasov michael nyqvist who becomes terribly upset at iosef for what he has done and desperately attempts to make amends with john unfortunately john refuses to talk and this results in viggo sending a dozen men to kill him at his home but john is waiting for them and none of them come back alive and now its his turn at any rate rather than reveal any more i will just say that i really enjoyed this particular movie and it kept me entertained from start to finish i especially liked the performance of keanu reeves who essentially owned the role and provided a dominating presence throughout in short i thought this was a really good film and i have rated it accordingly

the three actsthe initial tableau in modern day greater new yorknew jersey john wife helen suddenly dies of a long lingering illness his old acquaintance marcus gives his condolences after the burial he grieves for an interval in the days after the wake a puppy daisy is delivered with a note from helen john and daisy get to like each other while out with daisy getting gasoline two russian mobsters stop for gas at the same time iosef admires johns mustang and offers to buy either the car or the or both john declines and an older associate calls iosef off iosef and two friends break into johns house beat him up ruin beautiful things shoot daisy steal the mustang badly damage his newer car and steal the bracelet of helens that john kept near himdelineation of conflicts daisy was johns last living link with helen the necklace had similar importance john wants vengeance on iosef and on viggo aurelio informs viggo of iosefs actions viggo understands the problem that iosef has created that fckin nobody is he informs iosef the idiot he advises iosef to get out of his sight he asks his associate avi to task all his available men to take on john when that fails he sets a bounty of 2 million usd on johns head and also asks marcus to do the job as soon as possible will viggo live through this resolution the many conflicts were resolved in what i thought were reasonable ways i recommend this film to anyone who likes the genrethere are some great music tracks in this film and the incidental music was well chosen the actors were well miked and i had no problems picking up dialogfor a revenge movie this had a fine script the direction and the plot lines certainly raised my hopes that john would succeed in everything that he tried plus the end of iosef is something i looked forward to from very early on i seldom get that engaged with revenge films i loved the humour between old pairs of friends while there were lulls in the action

a friend of mine had see this movie and told me to go and watch it i asked him what its all about he simply said that its about a exbad ass coming out of his retirement to kill other bad asses of course i wasnt that interested because this kind of plot has been done to death over the time i heard a lot about this movie and decided to watch it and boy this is truly one of the best action movies of the yearkeanu reaves has done most of the stunts himself which has given the movie its realism no action scene in the movie looks artificial even the gun shooting scenes had a certain realism to it as you can see them reloading their guns at proper intervalsall in all this is an entertaining movie and specially a treat for the lovers of this genre and fans of keanu reeves dont expect many twists or shocking moments from the story as it is quite simple but it doesnt matter because even if they have kept the plot simple they have executed it to perfectionin the movie there is scene where a character says is man of focus commitment and sheer will after watching the movie i couldnt agree more enjoy

so many people who complain about him not waking up middle of the night after having retired thinking someone might be robbing him even if hes a badass people cannot simply wake up when it is time to kill it would demand that you have low iq if you think youre above humanity when being a retired hitman even with unlimited skillsat first i wrote a bad review 110 of this movie because of this assassin girl who is spared after trying to kill him as he is sleeping and severely wounded but he still decides to spare her for no other reasons then he must want her to kill him or anyone else or obviously in hollywood they love wasting quality for some women audience which i dont think they got because of that anyways but yeah its a big hole in the movie cause there is no way in hell someone as would not have her killedthe script to this film gave me cancer for a moment but honestly its a great action movie so i dont get why people keep whining about the movie being to much action and less drama to theses people id like to say never watch anything else but desperate house wives ever againgreat actorskeanu reevesmuch actionreality is not for superheroesno useless dramamob boss son have never heard anything about his best and lethal hitman which retired 5years ago did he recently adopt himstupid writerjohn is dark but not enough to kill a woman who backstabbs him and kills his friends how could this decision be madesexismfeminismmichaels accent did not fit very good as a russian tyvrr

is truly truly dreadful if you watch it with your brain turned on and analyse every part of the awfully weak and plot hole filled script or if you arent interested in a strange resurgence of american kungfu movies which are basically the same as asian ones except from instead of hand to hand combat its close quarters shooting with pistols followed by explosionsbut if you decide to take a break from watching films with a storyline characters that make sense or anything remotely good is the film for you its non stop action from beginning to end and who cares if it doesnt make sense if you can turn everything off and just relax and watch the carnage then you will enjoy john

its a basic gangster revenge movie where bad men disturb a sleeping bear and live just long enough to regret it it is also complete fantasy a new york city where no one who dies has has family no innocent people get hurt and superassassins stay in their own luxury hotelthe movie makes up its own rules but it sticks to them is destructible he is not stronger than his enemies but merely faster more resourceful and more determined his weapons run out of bullets and do not do more damage than those of his opponents  he just shoots them more accurately it is not realistic  it isnt supposed to be  but the conflicts are balanced enough that his revenge feels earnedit is also stylishly shot the small depth of field technique adds a otherworldliness that does not distract from the entertainment but does serve i think to distance us enough from the violence that it doesnt feel sickeningbut the best things about the film what really makes it work is the tight focused plot the minimalyeteminentlyquotable dialogue and the commitment of everyone in the cast to make their characters memorable

i love a good revenge story there is about these kind of tales we can get behind choose a side and thats usually enough to justify the violence in most movies nowadays is a revenge story and on merits of its action scenes a pretty amazing ride however where it excels in quick paced action it certainly leaves a lot to be desired in storyis a well to do man in his 30s seemingly wealthy and in love his wife is beautiful and she has a way of making him whole but these things rarely last and his world is about to come apart at the seems he has a hidden past something he isnt proud of but its what has given him this life of luxury and the ability to spend so much time with his wife shortly after the beginning of the film in which we find our main character badly wounded we enter a series of flashbacks where we learn his wife had become ill to some unknown disease and he has very little time to process this loss as events unfold john returns to his old ways on a killing spree against new foes and some old ones as wellthe story that unfolds isnt great by any means but there are some real amazing action sequences of such military precision that they are a pleasure to watch keanu reeves underwent 4 months of firearms training and it really shows through his work some of the best action sequences are the close quarters hand to hand combat where used a lot of japanese jujitsu but incorporates his firearm in so many of the moves slightly reminiscent of the film equilibrium 2002 although some might be turned off by the level of violence and high body count this is really why you watch a movie like thisunfortunately the plot itself is so outrageously thin and badly written that it kind of ruins the whole thing for me when i think of the classic revenge story a few titles come to mind right away oldboy 2013 or django unchained 2012 for example the main characters of these films are men obsessed with revenge and you can easily understand why the characters would go to such lengths to get back at the people who have done wrong by them this is what is missing i couldnt understand why a man would throw his life away for the memory of someone who is already dead he goes up against an army of mafiosos and leaves bodies all over the city and anyone who gets in his way is a dead man but why i couldnt grasp that concept in this film and it left me so unsatisfied and crying in disbeliefso it does have some of the best fire fights ive seen in a film and excellent hand to hand choreography michael nyqvist nearly lost an ear but the whole premise of the movie kind of fell flat in my eyes but i hear this is the first in a trilogy so they have lots of room to improve story line in the future610

keanu reeves has been recently bereaved and as a last gift to him his late wife has given him a presumably so that he wont be lonely and so that he has something to remember her by a short while after a gang approach with the intention of purchasing his car refuses to sell the car and has a minor altercation with one gang member and promptly drives off later the gang track down beat him up and kill his it turns out that was a former employee of viggo tarasov michael nyqvist who is the father of the man who killed when tarasov gets wind that is the man thats coming after his son he does everything he can to defend himself against someone whom he knows is a formidable adversarywhen i saw the premise for this film it reminded me of revenge for jolly  a truly awful film involving people getting revenge against someone for killing their this put me off watching this film initially as i feared that this would be another awful dogrelated revenge film thankfully is a million times better than revenge for jolly for several reasons keanu reeves plays the title character of and it seems that he was channelling liam neeson in the taken films inevitably reeves suffers by comparison because he arguably lacks the screen presence that neeson brings but he is still effective here  although sometimes it is hard not to feel as though youre watching a poor mans liam neeson in a poor mans taken even though it feels like a poor mans taken it is still very enjoyable basically for the same reasons that taken is a good film in that once it gets going it very rarely loses momentum guaranteeing that boredom will not set into me it felt like directors chad stahelski  david leitch had watched a few luc besson films as the style and the fight choreography are very similar its fast and frenetic and both directors do well to get a credible performance from reeves  hes not the most reliable of actors but is actually quite good at being emotive here and screenwriter derek kolstad does a good job in setting the story up and getting some heart into the filmas with most action films you get the impression that action comes first and writing comes second as there are a few flaws within the script for starters we dont learn much about former employers nor do we learn much about what theyre all about i didnt really understand why they needed to steal his car at the start or what was going on at the place where they delivered his car to was it stolen to order it also seemed contrived that the gang were able to find after they left him  unless they followed him home so yes has its fair share of flaws and yes there isnt much in the way of originality here however if youre looking for a fairly fastpaced thriller with plenty of impressive action sequences then this is definitely worth your time

my own scale of rating movies is simple there are just three possibilities 1  waste of time 5  entertaining but leaves you unsatisfied 10  superbis a perfect 5 keanu reeves is delivering a fine performance i am not really a fan of him so fine means he is not annoying but entertaining the reasons to watch this movies aremuch well paced shoot out action mixed with enjoyable martial arts it almost feels like a music video when the actions scenes start to roll youll hear thick drum and bass club music fast cuts painful stunts and musclecarshowoff the story is almost a no brainer which is for some days perfectly okay usually i have my brains switched on generally so following flaws spoiled this fast cooked action fast food soupthe story and development of characters is static and very predictable what the movie also lacks is a real terrifying evil antagonist look on one hand we have keanu who really is bad ass on the evil side we have michael nyqvist a mafia boss but i dont believe him i was wondering where is the real mafia boss not his writerafter all the movie is a box office success if i would have paid a cinema ticket i would have regret the waste of money now on amazon prime its ok

have you ever wanted to go on a crazy rampage because someone killed your stars keanu reeves michael nvqvist and willem dafoe and is directed by chad stahelski who funnily enough was the stunt coordinator and instructing actor for keanu reeves in the matrix i enjoyed this film for the most part there was some very good realism that you rarely see in movies mostly in the action sequences john actually reloads they used really cool unique subtitles for the russian dialogue and some of the comic relief in serious situations was perfect my issues with the film have a lot to do with the story and characters i never was really interested in mr or anyone else there i found myself waiting for the next action sequence rather than enjoying the story itself i also have had a hard time with keanu reeves ever since i first saw him in hardballthat combined with my lack of excitement for most action movies today due to clichs is the reason i gave this a b 610 johnkeanureeves hitman actionmovie

if you ever want to get lost for a while and forget about your immediate surroundings may be the solution for you the movie is 101 minutes of nonstop action through which the bad guys get it in all sorts of captivating ways there are no twists no mind benders no smart was of taking someone out just one straight shoot them dead sequence after another the action scene choreography is really well done camera work is great so despite all the rapid action you will not miss any detailsif you do not have the stomach for blood or violence then skip it otherwise get cozy and watch the boogeyman do his thing

ever wondered what the matrixs bulletstopping neo keanu reeves would be like in the real world he would probably be like the eponymous former assassin of codirectors chad stahelski and the uncredited david leitchs refreshing action movie which puts coherency back into setpieces and polishes its simplistic premise with buckets of style theres a key scene in the middle of the movie where sledgehammers his way through the concrete floor of his basement to reveal a hoard of buried weapons he is literally digging up his past and is symbolic of the films refusal to have its protagonist brood over heavy themes and its willingness to simply let him get down to businessthat business unfortunately for a gang of russian mobsters is of a highly skilled assassin mourning the recent death of the woman he left his life of crime behind for receives a puppy who his wife arranged to be sent to him upon her death at a gas station the cocky iosef alfie allen  the son of a mob boss  spots 69 mustang and when refuses to sell iosef and his cronies break into his house kill his and leave him battered and bloodied iosefs father viggo michael nyqvist finds out and begins to contemplate the inevitable  warpath of revenge and the death of his son taking residence at a hotel that caters for men of his ilk finds himself wastedeep in the life he thought he had left behindtheres a lot of joy to be had with the boldness of operatic overblown and featuring a scene of viggo muttering a tale of the boogeyman to himself in a room lit by a roaring fireplace it transcends its straighttodvd plot with some outlandish and truly thrilling setpieces free of shakycam and rapid editing shoots stabs and strangles his way through an endless russian hoard and allows a flowing camera to capture his asskickery reeves is at his best when he says little and hes virtually silent here delivering a performance of endearing sullenness it is by no means a great film  its hampered by genre conventions and a wafer thin plot  but you certainly get what you came in for

when i watched trailer i thought the movie will be awesome as i was blown by it so i wanted the movie to be good and when i watched it i was blown by the movie too the acting and action done by reaves was just quite awesome he looks working hard for this movie and he really did it despite he is fifty years old he has done superb action he looked a real bad ass assassin and he has set a new benchmark in action by doing gunfuand the other supporting cast were also good at their places and this film also tells us one thing never mess with a otherwise you will be killed and alloverall the film was awesome and a must watch for action lovers and also those who love brutal action like me the film is a good treat for usi heard about its sequel is in works definitely going to that one

im a big fan of action movies and especially keanu reeves he often gets crap over his acting skills or lack thereof i think hes well suited to action movies where a lot of the time story is told through the action sequences and a bit more nuanced its hard to find fault with this movie and ive seen it at least 34 times all the actors supporting or main do a great job there is a lot of action in this movie and the movie does start out a bit slow but then picks up very quickly the action gun fu and stunts are awesome some of the best ive seen in a long time you can tell they really practiced and tweaked the stunts a lot there are often long action segments with a brief intermission of story which is how i like most of my movies the soundtrack is amazing as well with marilyn manson contributing to the main theme of the movie and the composer for the movie doing a great job i would have liked to see william dafoes character expanded on some more but that may come in the second movie in flashback sequences

some of these reviews are a joke loosen your shorts people im not sure what some thought they were going to get with keanu in another action movie a shoot em up high body count fast action and shiny cars movie but a classic meaningful flick was never in the cards if you dont like gun fights video games style action or fast cars  you wont like this movie this movie is like a country song he lost his wife lost his and lost his car  and then he gets revenge on the spoiled idiot mobsters son it took me half the movie to figure out that was the guy from got i knew his face i just could t remember who he was who had no idea who he was messing with is it realistic that depends on how much realism you expect to gain from an action movie are they ever nope not one of them its got about as much realism as kill bill which i love that does not make it a bad movie the thing i do like about this move  if nothing else  is they showed him reloading his weapons multiple times action movies dont typically do that so they get points for not having guns that never run out of bullets as for the actingkeanu  he did a great job with this is stoic and not in a good place at all and they messed with him on the wrong damn day i actually prefer him when hes not the hero good guy when he plays a darker role he seems more relaxed guess theres no hero pressure there my only complaint is willem dafoe  ian macshane didnt have bigger roles but they did a great job with what they did have im so tired of reviews blasting thrillride movies because theyre not how the reviewer thinks an action movie should be its easy to criticize when youre not the one putting the work in is it perfect nope but its fun  if you like this brand of fun

imdb is normally a good judge of standard but i cant understand why this rates so high very disappointed spending good money time and effort watching it in the cinema for such a low grade film i would have been happier if i spent 50p buying it in a boot sale and could have resold it again the following week limited plot and dialogue but action was good and kept me awake when occasionally i found myself nodding off some of the plot is implausible and not to be believed it didnt keep my interest and i wouldnt recommend watching this film unless your looking for a break from thinking too much and want a rest if your looking for excitement this film is not the answer

rare is the film which strikes on the perfect mix of worldcreation atmosphere and action superbly shot in metallic shades of dark blue grey and black set in a world that can  and should if you ask me spawn a cinematic universe on its own and proceeding with a glorious sense of fun is the action movie and say what you will about keanu reeves acting he can play a cypher pretty well keanu reeves is an exsuperhitman who is recovering from a personal tragedy a couple of gangsters disturb his mourning the bloodshed starts from there and does not stop till the end of the film the film is highly reminiscent of the 80s hong kong actioners such as a better tomorrow both in style and in the themes explored such as the impossibility of retirement from the criminal world this movie is highly recommended for any action fan and if your heart does not leap with joy when victor the main antagonist says no is not the boogeymanhe is the guy we send to kill the boogeyman  you are dead inside

this is a very silly film redeemed by the fact that it appears to glory in its ludicrousnesskeanu reeves takes a very fine italian suit on a number of increasingly violent adventures to avenge hisumpuppy a former enforcer for the russian mob he is feared as baba yaga which we are told again and again is the boogeyman that anyone remotely aware of folklore can tell you that baba isnt the boogeyman is the least of this films narrative flaws the curious incident of the kevlar vest that vanished in the night is a fairly major plotgoofthat it works is down to reevess deadpan delivery of some preposterous dialogue the playful use of supporting actors ian mcshane clarke peters and lance reddick are very amusing more could be made of michael nyqvist and alfie allen seems to be destined for a career playing a succession of disappointing sonsalso if you like shootemups this is very much your film  or franchise i should say the producers intentions in that regard are very clear long before the credits roll reeves offs a ludicrous number of baddies  i literally lost count in the mid50s  while having only one of their weapons come anywhere near himand only then because that kevlar vest i mentioned seems to have inexplicably evaporated between scenesas i say very silly indeedbut fun if you are amused by cartoon violence

james bond jack bauer jason bourn jack reacher john carter and now  writers do seem to have limited imaginations when it comes to the names of their action heroes jw is a retired assassin and we all know that in the movies it doesnt take much to bring a man with a very particular set of skills back into the game kidnapping his daughter usually does it but if you want to be sure kill his this really makes keanu reeves back on cracking form mad of course we knew who the bad guys were even before their mistake with the mutt because they speak russian and the subtitles are presented in comic book style to add to the funtheres minimal plot but maximum action in this film directed by chad stahelski keanus stunt double in the matrix and david leitch another veteran stunt coordinator is not out simply to disable his foes but instead never leaves death in doubt and he is no silent assassin but absolutely litters the screen in bodies in a riot of action and noise that somehow escapes the notice of the new york police department according to those who count these things the original taken movie clocked up a body count of 35 but racks up a much superior 76 i saw the movie on an imax screen so i was both shaken and stirred

is the greatest action movie of all time i have seen all of the great action movies and none of them are better than i have seen three times twice in imax and once at home and the first time i saw it i was so blown away i had to go back a few days later to see it again then i waited for it to come out on dvd and watched it again and thats when i decided it was the greatest action movie of all time this movie gives you everything you want in an action movie the story is perfect it grabs you and keeps you hooked the entire time they give you an action hero to root for the whole movie the movie does an amazing job with first getting you to see as a human so you can understand the pain he is in and then the movie builds him up to be a feared and respected legend of this underworld and when the action starts you will understand why it is the greatest action movie of all time the gun play in this movie is by far the best i have ever seen in any movie kills so many people it is awesome read the trivia section to find out how many keanu reeves gives the performance of his career the directors chad stahelski and david leitch were stunt men their whole careers and is the first movie they have ever directed which explains why the action is so perfect in this movie i dont want to give any spoilers because i know as a huge movie fan that nothing is worse than finding out too many details before you see a movie trust me and go see right away i recommend this movie to everyone i give a 10 out of 10 a

if you mess with a mans car better look out if you mess with a mans better look out but if you mess with a mans car and his well theres just no tellingkeanu reeves is the perfect actor for this type of thing that is a character that is myopic speaks in short stunted sentences and never looks distracted by anything requiring thought beyond those instinctive and highly trained survival skillsthis is one of those that must be applauded for not reneging on its promise to deliver what you pay for it knows its target audience and doesnt try a bit to educate enlighten or expand their worldview it serves up just what is expected and required to not disappointthanks also for the r rating no cop out fudging the violence that would have been a disaster just look at the expendables movies when there is so much carnage on screen and no blood or heads exploding the result is a dull affair of repetitive frolicking in laughable and lame action scenesnot that this thing is trying to be realistic far from it its roots clearly lie in first person shooter land and there is about as much dialog or concern for character development as in a video game shoot em upthats really all this is and it makes no apologies there is the added treat of many cameos by recognizable character actors and that adds to the fun the movie isnt anything that special its just a highly competent and enjoyable ride of revenge flick mayhem and requires you bring nothing more to the screening than a desire for escapism

with the action genre running low on fresh if not entirely original ideas over the past several years this stylish action film starring keanu reeves as the titular character is one that comes with surprise this movie sees reeves reuniting with chad stahelski and david leitch who served as the fight choreographers for the matrix trilogy and redefining himself as a new hero with hightrained set of skills with guns and handtohand combat although reeves is no stranger to the action genre since he exploded as the visceral action hero neo in the matrix this film pins the actor into a fine polished role as a guntotting hero facing down the guys calling this film is a gamechanger in the genre would be saying a bit much but it does indeed stand as one of the most entertaining films of the category in further words it shows the genre is still far from dead keanu reeves plays a former assassin devastated by the death of his wife after days of mourning is surprised with a gift of cute little puppy to help cope with his lonesomeness while trying to readjust to his life is visited by a group of russian mobsters lead by losef tarasov played by alfie allen son of corrupt mob moss viggo tarasov played by michael nyqvist who brutally attack him destroy his house steal his mustang and murder his poor little puppy in an act of revenge must rally up his former accomplices including marcus played by william defore and chop shop owner aurelio played by john leguizamo to hunt them downthis movie provides action movie junkies with plenty of thrills and visceral action set pieces to fuel the adrenaline for most although the plot is rather thin and falls short of originality beyond a simple revenge story the major driving force of the film is the dazzlingly choreographed action sequences along with the compelling character study of our tragic titular protagonist from the opening scene is established as a man with a grim past and faces a deep tragedy with the death of his wife from an illness that is never specified the beginning effectively breaths humanity into the character without being overly sappy or manipulative and the final product is a protagonist viewers can sympathize with even when he journeys to the dark side of gunning down countless individuals when the action begins it is truly stunning the first action set piece takes place in the main characters house where he fights and mows down an array of criminals in a sequence choreographed in a style of what almost resembles a poetic dance routine and this scene is only the beginning of the enormously high body count he racks up throughout the film while the action scenes stand out gracefully the films shortcoming perhaps come from the characters mostly from the antagonist category alfie allen and michael nyqvist both do their duty in the villain roles but fall victim to rather underwritten characters why did they try to kill a explanation is never deeply explored or at least not in a way that is understandable and william defoes character is given rather little to do overall these come as only minor gripes and should not stand in the way to witness the alluring direction chad stahelski and david leitch drive this fastpaced vehicleis a sleek stylish action thriller that redefines its charismatic lead actor as a visceral action hero and at best sprouts as a shining star in the slowly diminishing genre this film may not shine as a game changer in the genre it clearly sets a solid example of what meets the criteria of a good action flick

one thing i noted while watching was its simple story told with fascinating execution and commendable action scenes and that is the beauty of this film which was overstretched in the climax but was saved by outstanding scriptis an exhitman who comes out of his retirement in search of a mafias son who was responsible for killing his the last gift sent by his late wifefirst time directors chad stahelski and david leitch did pretty well in shaping the movie to be a blunt and taut revenge actionpacked thriller the movie takes sometime to build on but when it does  there is no turning back each scene is beautifully depicted with rocking background score and applauding dialogues it gives an holistic view of gangland and rules they live in and high respect for each other icing on the cake is the wellchoreographed action scenes which has been executed brilliantly with graphic bloodshed looking like a pc game script is tight and will keep you engaged the flipside is unnecessary inclusion of climax scenes which could be easily be edited keanue reeves is back in form and i loved him after long time especially post matrix series he does well in dialogues delivery and will be appreciated for his actingoverall a kickass action which will pump up your adrenalin good 35

wowi loved this film mr reeves is great in this film i love all the crimegangster films anyway although it might not go down as one of the greats it is still in its own rite a great filmloads of action revenge fighting killingwhat more would you need in a moviesglad to see mr reeves back on the big screen in a good action role once againplease please watch this film its really really goodenjoy

the film that has been branded as keanu reeves comeback and to be fair it is a good film its stylish and has a interesting plot with lots of action a 100 true bloke film butand there is a but and its that there is no soul in this film yes you feel sorry for but you dont become attached or bothered if he wins or loses in this film this is not really keanu reeves fault as he does play the role well i think it may be the scripting of the film the realism that lacks heavily in it william defoe does a great supporting role in the film which you would expect i would advise you to watch as its a good film but at 1hr 40mins you will walk away thinking they could of probably done that in less time does bring keanu reeves back to our big screens but there are bigger films due out this year which will make this one quickly disappear

starts with promise and quickly devolves into stupidity hijacking the current template for action films pioneered by the raid series in which a single determined hero takes up arms against hundreds of nameless one dimensional bad guys in a rapid fire killing spree its not that i have anything against bloodshed in film provided it serves a purpose but theres really nothing of substance here to grab onto leaving us with scene after scene of revengemurder chic that plays more like a video game than a film never has cold blooded murder looked so coolis nicely shot and opens on a dreary and mysterious note one that i wish the film would have sustained with a better story and better character development without the fundamentals we might as well be pressing buttons jump dive shoot if i try and step back and critique it purely as action entertainment  the film is lacking in interesting choreography or chase sequences basically happens upon completely unbelievable scenarios over and over again pulls a gun out and shoots no matter how many times the filmmakers put him into uncompromising positions i never feel like hes in any danger the routine gets boring after the first half hour and eventually the autopilot sets in
i dont understand how this has 73 total waste of an evening
this is a decent action movie but dont expect much more just so so
we should kill you why do animals have to die in movies i know they might not have died in real life but why in movies lets kill all you and put you in a film see how you like it

as the title clearly tells us this movie is really about one man  john is a sort of super perhaps even superhuman hit man for the russian mob but hes retired he found love he got married everything was great he left the life but his wife got sick and then died and as her parting gift to the devastated john she arranges for him to be sent a puppy after she died the puppy comforts him in his grief until  one day he has an encounter with the son of the russian mob boss he used to work for they dont know each other the guy falls in love with johns car and later breaks into johns house beats john up kills johns puppy and steals johns car it was the killing of the puppy  the last link with his beloved wife  that pushed john over the top hes back and hes out for revenge bloody merciless and remorseless revenge against anybody and everybody even remotely involved with this heinous actthats it more or less the movie then goes through a whole series of bloody gunfights and fistfights and martial arts sequences as john keanu reeves singlehandedly wreaks havoc on the russian mob in new york city the fight scenes go on and on and on they seem neverending it was a very onedimensional part for reeves but then again most of the characters in this were one dimensional the point of the movie wasnt to tell a story or to give us meaningful moments and characters they were all pretty one dimensional working with a plot that was straightforward and largely predictable this is obviously all leading up to the climactic confrontation admittedly i wasnt entirely sure who johns final confrontation was going to be with until the son was killed with almost a half hour left to go clearly it wasnt him so it goes on and on and on for a while longerpersonally i found the last half hour quite tedious viewing if you really like this kind of genre  violent and bloody action with little or no story  then this is a movie youve got to watch i have to admit that this just really wasnt my style even though i can appreciate a man wanting to take revenge for the killing of his puppy 310
